tips.title: Grocery Store Gift Card Hack
tips.tip: Buy gift cards at grocery stores using a card with grocery bonus category (Amex Gold 4X). Turn everyday 1X purchases into 4X earning!
tips.pro_tip: Only buy gift cards you'll actually use - don't manufacture spend you can't liquidate easily.

tips.title: Book ANA Awards via Virgin Atlantic
tips.tip: Save 50% on ANA First Class by booking through Virgin Atlantic Flying Club instead of directly through ANA. Same seats, half the points!
tips.pro_tip: Wait for Amex 30-40% transfer bonuses to Virgin Atlantic for even more value.

tips.title: Always Chase 5/24 First
tips.tip: Chase cards are subject to 5/24 rule (denied if you've opened 5+ cards in 24 months). Get Chase cards BEFORE Amex, Citi, or Capital One.
tips.pro_tip: Business cards from Chase don't count toward 5/24, so you can stack them after hitting 5/24.

tips.title: Hilton Diamond Status via Credit Card
tips.tip: The Hilton Aspire Card ($450 AF) gives you instant Diamond status plus a free weekend night certificate. Diamond = breakfast, lounge, suite upgrades.
tips.pro_tip: Time your application in December so the free night posts in January and again in December of same year.

tips.title: Check Award Space 330 Days Out
tips.tip: Most airlines release award seats 330-365 days before departure. Set a calendar reminder to search exactly 330 days from your desired travel date.
tips.pro_tip: Search at midnight in the airline's home timezone for best results.

tips.title: Stack Amex Shop Small + Rakuten
tips.tip: During Shop Small promos, Amex gives extra points at small businesses. Stack this with Rakuten cashback at same merchants for double-dipping.
tips.pro_tip: Use Amex Gold (4X dining/grocery) at registered Shop Small businesses for insane multipliers.

tips.title: Hyatt Has Best Hotel Redemption Value
tips.tip: Hyatt points consistently offer 1.5-2.5 cents per point value, while Marriott/Hilton hover around 0.5-0.7cpp. Chase transfers to Hyatt at 1:1.
tips.pro_tip: Target Category 1-4 Hyatt hotels for maximum value (8-15K points per night for $200+ hotels).

tips.title: Track Your CPP (Cents Per Point)
tips.tip: Always calculate cents per point (CPP) on redemptions: (Cash price Ã· Points required) Ã— 100. Target 1.5+ CPP minimum, 2+ CPP for good value.
tips.pro_tip: Sometimes paying cash is better than 'wasting' points on low-value redemptions. Don't redeem just to redeem!

tips.title: Self-Refer with Player 2
tips.tip: Have a spouse/partner? Refer each other for credit cards to earn referral bonuses (10-20K points) on top of welcome bonuses.
tips.pro_tip: Space out apps 2-3 months apart and mix with organic cards to avoid velocity shutdowns.

tips.title: Use Google Flights for Award Research
tips.tip: Google Flights shows cash prices and dates with availability. Use it to find cheap dates, then search award space on those exact dates.
tips.pro_tip: Sort by price graph to visualize cheapest dates across entire months.

tips.title: Triple-Dip Welcome Bonuses
tips.tip: Time new card applications in January to triple-dip: SUB + annual credit Year 1 + annual credit Year 2 (Dec), then cancel before Year 2 AF hits.
tips.pro_tip: This works best with cards like Amex Plat ($200 airline credit), CSR ($300 travel credit).

tips.title: Book Refundable Awards as Placeholders
tips.tip: Found OK award space but not great? Book it! Most airline awards are free to cancel. Hold the space while searching for better options.
tips.pro_tip: Set reminders to recheck availability weekly. Cancel and rebook if better space opens up.

tips.title: Marriott Platinum Challenge Worth It
tips.tip: Complete 16 nights in 90 days to earn Platinum status for rest of year + next full year. That's 15-21 months of status from just 16 nights!
tips.pro_tip: Do challenge in January-March to maximize duration. Platinum = breakfast, lounge, suite upgrades.

tips.title: Plastiq for Large Expenses
tips.tip: Use Plastiq to pay rent, mortgage, or tuition with credit cards. 2.5% fee, but worth it for SUBs or high-earning cards.
tips.pro_tip: Only use Plastiq when earning >3% back or hitting minimum spend for welcome bonus.

tips.title: Singapore Suites via Amex
tips.tip: Singapore Airlines Suites (A380) is bucket-list travel. Book using KrisFlyer miles transferred from Amex MR. ~180K miles round-trip USA-Asia.
tips.pro_tip: Space opens 330 days out. Set alerts and book immediately - it goes FAST.

tips.title: Space Out Credit Card Applications
tips.tip: Don't apply for more than 1-2 cards per month. Issuers watch 'velocity' and may deny or shut down accounts if you apply too fast.
tips.pro_tip: Ideal pace: 1 card every 2-3 months for beginners, 2-3 cards per month for experienced churners.

tips.title: HUCA (Hang Up, Call Again)
tips.tip: If an airline agent says award space doesn't exist but you see it online, hang up and call again. Different agents have different knowledge levels.
tips.pro_tip: Be polite but persistent. Sometimes calling 3-4 times gets you a competent agent who can book what you need.

tips.title: Downgrade Instead of Canceling
tips.tip: Don't cancel premium cards after Year 1 - downgrade to no-AF versions to preserve credit history and relationship with issuer.
tips.pro_tip: Wait until after 12 months to downgrade (some issuers claw back bonuses if you cancel/downgrade early).
